SEARCH
Package server.core

Class Server

java.lang.Object
server.core.Server
Direct Known Subclasses:
ServerMain
public class Server extends Object
The `Server` class represents a basic server application for handling client connections and processing messages.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Tomasz Zbroszczyk

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server(ConfigHandler configHandler)
      Constructs a `Server` instance with the specified configuration handler.
      Parameters:
      configHandler - The configuration handler to use for server configuration.

    • Server

      public Server()
      Default constructor for the `Server` class.

  • Method Details

    • startServer

      public void startServer()
      Starts the server, accepts client connections, and handles incoming messages.

    • listenForInputInBackground

      private void listenForInputInBackground()
      Listens for user input in the background. It allows the server operator to enter commands through the console. The available commands are "exit" (to gracefully stop the server), "ping" (to ping all clients), and "clear" (to clear the terminal screen).

    • clearTerminal

      private void clearTerminal()
      Clears the terminal window where the server is running. The method detects the operating system and runs the appropriate command to clear the terminal screen. It supports Windows, Unix/Linux, and macOS.

    • pingAllClients

      private void pingAllClients()
      Pings all connected clients to check for responsiveness.

    • closeAllClientConnections

      private void closeAllClientConnections()
      Closes all client connections and stops the server.

    • getClientKey

      private String getClientKey(Socket socket)
      Generates a unique key for identifying a client based on their IP address and port.
      Parameters:
      socket - The socket associated with the client.
      Returns:
      A unique key for identifying the client.

    • pingClientsInBackground

      private void pingClientsInBackground()
      Pings clients at regular intervals in the background.

    • pingClients

      private void pingClients()
      Pings all connected clients to check for responsiveness. This method iterates through connected clients and sends ping messages to each client. If a client doesn't respond within the specified time, it is considered unresponsive and removed from the list of clients.

    • checkArgs

      public static void checkArgs(String[] args, ConfigHandler configHandler)
      Handles command-line arguments and overrides configuration properties.
      Parameters:
      args - An array of command-line arguments.
      configHandler - The configuration handler to override properties.
